185875526.review: After playing through this complete series (except the latest standalone) and finishing the story, I highly recommend these co-op puzzle games. They were a ton of fun and really made us think! There were plenty of moments to remember, from those a-ha moments that make you feel good, to some puzzles that made you laugh a little along the way. In our opinion, the 2nd and 3rd game in the series were the best, with the 4th one feeling a little too drawn out, but the story is well worth it to play through all 4 in order!

The puzzles are OK but not that interesting.

The worst thing I found about the game is that when you run out of time for a particular puzzle (hence failing that puzzle) the checkpoint you spawn at is sometimes before the prior puzzle that you've already solved - and having to solve that prior puzzle again & again can get quite tedious when all you want to do is solve the current puzzle you're stuck on. We stopped playing the game for this reason.

I also don't like the eerie environment - but that's just me.

Give it a try. Over and out ;)

O jogo é direto ao ponto, então essa análise também será.

-Jogo simples, divertido, COOP, leve, bem ambientado, mistério na medida certa, suspense, e um final intrigante. 
-Você e companhia irão passar o tempo rindo do baixo QI um do outro pra tentar desvendar as coisas e vão zerar que nem perceberam.
-Única fase que talvez precisem de ajuda é a do labirinto/mapa que chega a ser mais confusa mas nada impossível.
-Grátis e 100% recomendável

185608352.review:
Puedes seguir nuestra página de mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/45082041/] Aquí [/url].

Tenemos ante nosotros el primer juego de puzles cooperativos que da nombre a la saga homónima. 

Con este juego voy al grano:

El peor de toda la saga. No es ya que sea el primero y pueda tener fallitos, es que es un completo sinsentido. 

Tiene múltiples bugs a la hora de pulsar palancas y piezas en el ajedrez. Luego en el puzle del ajedrez no te puedes morir y reintentarlo y te llevas todo el rato con la pantalla cubierta de nieve y sin ver nada. 

Más adelante hay otro puzle de encontrar un camino en un libro, el cual está mal redactado, intenta ser “críptico y poético” pero realmente está mal redactado. Los puntos de término de frase no están donde deben y las frases están mal puestas, intentando ser más desafiante su lectura, pero resulta agotador descifrar algo aleatorio.

En el siguiente puzle (donde lo dejamos) te presenta un teatro y no te explica absolutamente nada. No sabes cuando es el tope de las manivelas, ni lo que estás moviendo sin que te lo diga tu otro compañero, además de tampoco sabes que hace la palanca de escena ni de luces (lógicamente uno servirá para las luces y el otro para validar la escena si es correcta, pero cuando le das hacen cosas raras y reinicia a veces el puzle, otras veces no, etc). Además, los cartones de las escenas, cambian y no hay imputs sonoros suficientes ni visuales para saber cuando es correcto, cuando no, cuanto te queda de la escena, cuantas escenas hay, etc).

Es un absoluto despropósito este juego, por algo está gratis. Lo que no entiendo es la cantidad de reseñas positivas, supongo que serán positivas porque no han pagado por el juego.

Si queréis jugar algo de este tipo puzle- cooperativo de la misma empresa os recomiendo el Forever o el Expeditions (el “Too” no llega al nivel del 1 en cuanto a mal nivel, pero también es malo y tiene muchos bugs).


Nota: 3 /10                                                                   Valoración: No Recomendado

185552677.review: Not a fan of the game.  There's no real instruction to it, and no real story or point.  Me and a friend played it for two hours, just trying to make sense of it.  You go through a lot of tasks that require teamwork, but you have to die a few times until you can guess what it all means, and try to make sense of it while talking to one another via walkies.  It looked cool but when you play it, it's sort of a huge let down.  There's no connection between tasks.  It's just puzzle solving without rhyme or reason.

185510842.review: My best friend & I have played the entire We Were Here series, and him & I have loved every single one! They get increasingly more challenging & longer with each new game, which was awesome! Might drive you nuts if you can’t communicate well with your co-op partner though, you need one another from start to finish! We have tried to find similar series that are just as good and nothing has even come remotely close! We are going to run through them all again simply because we miss the game play! HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you are looking for a CO-OP puzzle series!

185341994.review:
A good first entry into the series, but with some flaws. I liked the co-operative experience of being split apart into different areas with a unique role (librarian or explorer). This encouraged communication and observation with each other in the environments to solve the puzzles and proceed further into the castle. 

It offers a good variety of puzzles that were mostly enjoyable and provided appropriate clues to solve. However, there were two puzzles that were frustrating trying to figure out the solution during the first playthrough. This did ruin the experience overall. 

Playing on controller and interacting with some objects was clunky but it wasn’t a huge impact. There were some public lobbies going when I played this, but the in-game voice chat functionality sometimes didn’t work at all, so I would recommend playing with a friend using Discord.

Overall, it’s a free game and offers some replayability trying out both roles to get all the achievements. This is a suitable choice to start with for anyone looking to play a co-op escape room together.

Verdict: 6 / 10

I have completed this game twice to get every achievement in the game. 

Pretty mediocre puzzles throughout this game. I did not find them difficult or challenging at any point. 

It took us about 4 hours for 100% achievement completion. Second play-through was twice as quick since you know what other person sees therefore makes getting all achievements quickly.

This games leaves me only positive vibes and i will definitely will be playing every part of the series of this game.

Highly recommended to play it out with a buddy.

184514312.review: In a world where many cooperative puzzlers tend to fall into the trap of being overly complex or too long for a casual gaming session, We Were Here stands out by offering a refreshing experience that's perfect for those short bursts of fun. The game focuses on a unique and engaging cooperative puzzle-solving mechanic where two players are stranded in a mysterious castle, separated by distance, and must communicate effectively to solve a series of intricate puzzles. Each player has distinct information, making collaboration essential for progressing.

Zagadki bardzo przemyślane, przy czym aby w ogóle przejść grę jako Librarian musi grać osoba, która jest zdolna je ogarnąć, jednocześnie kierując poczynaniami osoby będącą Discoverer-em.

184294199.review: very fun!! contrary to what some other reviewers say this game does have replay value, just not much. it's worth it to play at least twice per game partner, but there are also little secrets and easter eggs and it's fun to find those! the game is very creative both in its premise and in the gameplay itself and i've played this with multiple people and enjoyed it just as thoroughly each time.

184272176.review:
We Were Here is like an escape room for your brain, except you’re stuck in a mysterious castle with a friend, communicating solely through walkie-talkies and puzzle-solving chaos.

The catch? You can’t see what your partner sees, so prepare for a lot of yelling “Wait, no! The OTHER lever!” It’s tense, fun, and the perfect way to test your friendship—because nothing says "trust" like a communication breakdown. 

Great if you love puzzles and your friend’s sanity.

184268219.review:
Super cool, echt gruselig und wirklich voller Adrenalin. Eine Achterbahn der Gefühle. Spaß, Spannung, Adrenalin und Panik - hier ist für jeden was dabei.

Das Einzige, was ich bemängle, ist die Szene im Theater. Diese Marionette hat mir eine Nacht erholsamen Schlaf geraubt. Ich hatte wirklich Panik und wollte aus dem Theater raus flüchten, konnte aber nicht, da es eben Teil des Spiels war. Dieses Ding ist so dermaßen grauenhaft unheimlich, dass ich kurz davor war, das Spiel ohne Finish in die Tonne zu klopfen. 

Ansonsten war's echt eine gelungene Stunde.

АЛЕ найгірше у цій грі те, що чекпойнти відбуваються не в кожній кімнаті, і якщо ти десь помиляєшся, то часто доводиться перепроходити ВСЕ з самого початку. через це і через нелогічність у деяких головоломках ми і не закінчили цю гру, бо, по-перше, нам вже було тупо нецікаво, по-друге, ще б трохи і ми б повбивали одне одного в реальному житті, настільки нас почало це все дратувати.

183853333.review:
It's short, it's free, and it's a great taster for the rest of the series. There's nothing to lose trying this, as long as you have a friend you won't obliterate for not being on your wavelength. 

The aesthetics of this series are also a personal favourite, from the spooky arctic/castle atmosphere to the beautifully cartoony graphics.

183795415.review: Played this with my boyfriend and we were both pleasantly surprised by how fun this actually was. Some of the functions were a little clunky and affected gameplay but not by much. I will say, the marionette the first time we played scared the ever loving life out of me but I am not into creepy/scary things and this is in by no means a horror game, I'm just easily startled. We are looking forward to playing through the rest of the series, as it makes for a fun night of trying to communicate what we see in the best way we can (i.e. girl with pom poms, candelabra, duck with a snail shell).
